title: Calories in Onion Rings
meta_description: Discover calories in onion rings per 100g serving, including carbs, fat, protein, sodium, and tweaks for healthier options.
assumptions: Deep-fried, breaded onion rings; fast-food style, average values; serving size ~8 medium rings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, frying method, batter, and portion size. Check labels or restaurant info when available.

quick_answer.text: 100g of fried onion rings contains about 400 kcal, with high fat and carbs from breading and oil.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in a serving of onion rings?
faqs.a: About 400 kcal for a 100g serving of fried onion rings.

faqs.q: Are onion rings high in fat?
faqs.a: Yes, ~25g total fat per 100g, mostly from frying oil.

faqs.q: What's the carb content in onion rings?
faqs.a: Around 40g carbs per 100g, primarily from the breading.

faqs.q: Do onion rings have much protein?
faqs.a: Only about 5g protein per 100g; not a good protein source.

faqs.q: How to reduce calories in onion rings?
faqs.a: Opt for baked, air-fried, or homemade versions with less oil to cut 100-200 kcal per serving.
